', 'this job provides an excellent opportunity to explore new computer vision algorithms and collaborate with external partners on practical real-world problems.\xa0the use of computer vision is paramount\xa0to this project, with the opportunity to investigate advanced computational methods in an exciting domain area. you will be working among software and robotic engineers, machine learning and human-computer interaction experts.', 'roles:']['explore prototype techniques for object detection and recognition of aircraft defects', 'develop and implement novel computer vision algorithms ', 'support the integration of vision algorithms in application development ', 'support performance testing and benchmarking']['the above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. a*star may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. these policies may be amended from time to time without notice. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.']['phd in computer science, electrical engineering, or related field', 'minimum 1 year of industrial experience', 'strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills', 'good knowledge in computer vision, machine learning and image processing', 'experience with opencv', 'experience with programming languages such as c# or c++', 'familiarity with gpu computing an advantage ', 'awareness of good scientific practices', 'strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills', 'motivated and resourceful individual']

job_description_all_future: ['company overview:', 'google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. true, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. at google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. we provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. for more information, visit www.google.com/careers.', 'the area: google cloud', 'google cloud helps millions of job_description_all_future: ['the department of communications and new media at national university of singapore is looking to fill the following educator track (teaching only) positions.', 'senior lecturer\xa0in:', '(a) communication management (1 position)', 'we seek applicants with expertise in public relations and corporate communication, with experience (industry related and/or teaching) in one or more of the following areas:', '(b) interactive media design (1 position)', 'we seek applicants with expertise in data science, interactive media design and software studies. the applicant will have (industry related and/or teaching) experience in one or more of the following areas :', '(c) digital media cultures (1 position)', 'we seek applicants with expertise in cultural studies; new media art and digital film criticism, and; cultural and critical theories. the applicant will have (practice related and/or teaching) experience in:']['social media marketing and management', 'organisational and small group communication', 'public speaking and critical reasoning', 'crisis and risk communication', 'leadership, organisation and new media', 'data analytics, big data, data visualisation, and use of software tools such as r and python, and web technologies.', 'computational media and communication, and artificial intelligence', 'game studies', 'user interface, user experience and hci design', 'digital media cultures', 'globalisation and new media', 'culture and creative industry studies', 'digital storytelling']['successful candidates must have a phd in communications or a closely affiliated discipline by the appointment of start date and a record of excellence in teaching in large comprehensive universities. a passion for working closely with students and a commitment to student learning are essential. successful candidates are also expected to have experience with online teaching and the development of moocs.', 'appointment grade/requirements:\xa0phd degree or equivalent; with approximately 5 or more years of teaching experience (preferably at\xa0lecturer level, but experience as teaching assistant/instructor may be considered on a case-by-case basis)\xa0and evidence of impact in higher education settings required.', 'responsibilities:\xa0successful candidates are expected to teach five modules per academic year. other duties include supervising 4-6 honours students and graduate students, academic advising and undertaking service roles including coordinating the department’s compulsory internship programme.', 'the department of communications and new media was established as a full programme in 2004. it is currently ranked #1 in asia (the2018) and #14 in the world (qs2018). it has one of the largest student enrolments in the faculty of arts and social sciences. it offers undergraduate, honours and phd programmes in communications and new media studies, with an innovative curriculum that introduces students to key debates in the areas of media studies, communication management, interactive media design and cultural studies. its curriculum provides students with practical skills in social media management, user experience and user interface design, and digital marketing. its students undertake industry immersion through its compulsory internship programme. the department also offers an undergraduate double degree with the school of business; undergraduate minors in interactive media design and cultural studies, and the cultural studies in asia phd programme. its research concentrations are media effects and psychology, health communication and cultural studies.', 'please send in your application to ms jasmin tay (cnmbox15@nus.edu.sg). instructions on the application procedure can be found via the link - http://www.fas.nus.edu.sg/cnm/about-cnm/job-openings/academic-jobs', 'further information about the department can be found at: http://www.fas.nus.edu.sg/cnm/', 'more information about the university can be found at: http://www.nus.edu.sg/', 'applications close by 2 november 2018.', 'only short-listed candidates will be notified.'][None]

job_description_all_future:
['about the institute for infocomm research (i²r)', 'the institute for infocomm research (i²r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore’s largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg', 'we are looking for strong candidates in the field of artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains.\xa0', 'the position entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities at mit, stanford and cmu.', 'listed below are problems of interest in the deep leaming 2.0 project:', '\xa0multimodal deep learning: towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources
 currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. a multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.', 'unsupervised deep learning: towards 10x fewer labeled samples
 labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. the aim is to achieve the same performance with !ox fewer labeled training samples. this is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts ofunlabeled unstructured data.', 'deep learning on embedded devices: towards 100x smaller models
 current deep learning models have\xa010\xa0s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. the aim is to achieve models that are i00x smaller, with little loss in performance. this capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.', 'online deep learning: towards near real time (nrt) model updates
 state-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive gpu infrastructure. a common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always\xad learning system. algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.', 'extreme deep learning: training lb neural networks efficiently
 the high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing\xa0 amounts of data and model\xa0 size improves performance. however, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. the aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training.', 'deep learning for spoken language processing and natural language understanding: towards better modeling of human communication
 language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. however, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. this aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial ai players.', 'white-box deep learning: towards interpretable and contextually informed models
 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and appl ications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning: towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of\xa0 bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between \xa0entities, \xa0to improve classification accuracy.', '\xa0'][None]['the above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. a*star may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. these policies may be amended from time to time without notice. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.']['phd in computer science, statistics, or data science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas:  \xa0large-scale machine learning \xa0deep learning, supervised or unsupervised \xa0applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains  ', '\xa0large-scale machine learning', '\xa0deep learning, supervised or unsupervised', '\xa0applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains', 'experience in corporate or application orientated environments is a plus.', 'ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired.\xa0', 'good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications.', 'proficiency in spoken and written english.', 'experience with one of tensor flow, theano, caffee, cntk.', 'strong programming abilities (e.g. perl, bash, c/c++, java, python, r, matlab)', 'computer vision and deep learning skills desirable']

 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and appl ications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning: towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of\xa0 bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between \xa0entities, \xa0to improve classification accuracy.', '\xa0'][None]['the above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. a*star may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. these policies may be amended from time to time without notice. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.']['phd in computer science, statistics, or data science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas:  \xa0large-scale machine learning \xa0deep learning, supervised or unsupervised \xa0applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains  ', '\xa0large-scale machine learning', '\xa0deep learning, supervised or unsupervised', '\xa0applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains', 'experience in corporate or application orientated environments is a plus.', 'ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired.\xa0', 'good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications.', 'proficiency in spoken and written english.', 'experience with one of tensor flow, theano, caffee, cntk.', 'strong programming abilities (e.g. perl, bash, c/c++, java, python, r, matlab)', 'computer vision and deep learning skills desirable']

job_description_all_future: ['company overview:', 'google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. true, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. at google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. we provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. for more information, visit www.google.com/careers.', 'the area: engineering & operations', "google is and always will be an engineering company. we hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, ui design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. as a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. we need our job_description_all_future:
['about the institute for infocomm research (i²r)', 'the institute for infocomm research (i²r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore’s largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg', 'we are looking for strong candidates in the field of artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains.', 'the position, based within the program in artificial intelligence at i2r, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like mit, stanford and cmu.\xa0 listed below are problems of interest in the deep learning 2.0 project:', 'multimodal deep learning:\xa0towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources
 currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. a multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.
 
 unsupervised deep learning:\xa0towards 10x fewer labeled samples
 labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible.\xa0 the aim is to achieve the same performance with 10x fewer labeled training samples.\xa0 this is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data.', 'deep learning on embedded devices:\xa0towards 100x smaller models
 current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware.\xa0 the aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. this capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.', 'online deep learning:\xa0towards near real time (nrt) model updates
 state-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive gpu infrastructure. a common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system.\xa0 algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.', 'extreme deep learning:\xa0training 1b neural networks efficiently
 the high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance.\xa0 however, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. the aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training.', 'deep learning for spoken language processing and natural language understanding: towards better modeling of human communication', 'language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. however, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. this aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial ai players.', 'white-box deep learning:\xa0towards interpretable and contextually informed models
 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning:\xa0towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy.'][None]['the above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. a*star may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. these policies may be amended from time to time without notice. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.']['phd in computer science, statistics, data science intensive fields with expertise in one or more of the following areas: 	 large-scale machine learning deep learning, supervised or unsupervised applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains  ', 'large-scale machine learning', 'deep learning, supervised or unsupervised', 'applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains', 'possess phd experience in corporate or application oriented environments', 'ability to work independently', 'team player', 'experience with tensor flow, theano, caffe, cntk skills', 'strong programming skills in perl, bash, c/c++, java, python, r, matlab', 'possess computer vision and deep learning skills', 'good interpersonal and communication skills']

job_description_all_future: ['responsible to actively engage with internal and external stakeholders to establish a collaborative working relationship for the achievement of business and supply chain objectives. he/she is accountable to the supply chain processes of key customer including but not limited to warehouse capacity management, freight forwarder management, customs process management, client management, \xa0driving operation efficiencies, participating in continuous process improvement activities that drive best in class supply chain metrics, cost, service, inventory, and cycle time. by leveraging on data analytics, he/she will also minimize supply chain risks (operation, freight and customs) by working closely with all related departments.\xa0 main duties and responsibilities will be as follows:-', '\xa0', '\xa0']['supervise all movements (inbound, storage, vas, outbound, freight) along the supply chain.', 'be the single contact point of key customer and attend to all enquiries/escalations, follow through internally/externally up to the closure of all enquiries/escalations.', 'lead any project initiative/process improvement initiated internally/externally and ensure successful implementation, which include but not limited to project management, sop drafting and revision etc.', 'capacity management - actively review production backlog and work with customer, warehouse manager in capacity and shipment planning, critically propose shipment re-scheduling if necessary.', 'work closely with customer to increase operation efficiency and uplift overall customer service level.', 'monitor and drive order linearity by country and by product category against customer’s target.', 'operation process improvement – constantly review operation processes to identify potential gap or room for improvement. drives process change and automation to improve end-to-end supply chain efficiencies and to meet key supply chain metrics in term of cost, service, inventory, and cycle time.', 'monitor warehouse productivities and drive cost control initiatives and order fulfillment.', 'liaise with customers and clients of customers via e-mail & telephone for any escalation matters regarding inbound supply, storage, quality (discrepancies and damages), value added service, capacity, outbound transport, outbound freight, customs processes, it related enquiries, and follow through to close the matters.', 'communicate and coordinate abovementioned enquiries/escalations internally with functional department such as it, customs brokerage, transport and freight department.', 'kpi reporting and ensuring key performance indexes are met.', 'attend meetings regarding operations/alignment/improvement initiatives and prepare materials for presentation if necessary.', 'perform other job-related functions as and when assigned by the next-in-line manager/country manager. \xa0 ']['work location: 10 bulim avenue', 'transport provided at boon lay, jurong east & choa chu kang mrt']['degree in logistics/supply chain/warehouse management and/or industrial engineering', '3 - 5 years of relevant working experience in warehouse/logistics/freight forwarding.\xa0', 'experience in professional customer service, shipping process and documentation.', 'knowledge about bonded warehouse operation and related customs processes will be an advantage.', 'knowledge on shipping related documents such as fta documents, msds.', 'proficient in ms word, ms excel, ms powerpoint, ms visio and wms system.', 'ability to work in fast pace and dynamic environment.', 'willing to embrace change and ability to think quickly and perform problem solving tasks, even with changing conditions.', 'reaction time to multiple tasks with ability to prioritize.', 'good analytical and mathematical skills including data evaluation, identification, solution development and implementation.', 'self-motivated and goal oriented, with a positive proactive attitude and a high degree of initiative.', 'good communications, interpersonal skills and ability to build strong relationships both internally and externally.', 'good command of written and spoken in english.', 'influencing and collaborative skills across various levels in the organization.']

job_description_all_future: ['about the role', 'we’re changing the way people think about transportation. not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.', 'for the people who drive with uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. for cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.', 'and that’s just what we’re doing today. we’re thinking about the future, too. with teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we’re in for the long haul. we’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.', 'what you’ll do']['develop global and regional business development strategy, including opportunity sizing and prioritization of resources (bd, product, operations, marketing) in collaboration with the heads of business development strategy & planning', 'evaluate partnership opportunities across several industries, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses', 'drive team accountability by managing the deal pipeline and review process, ensuring deals serve company strategy, accounting for risk appropriately, monitoring competitive developments, and conducting impact assessments / readouts in collaboration with the data analytics team', 'routinely present results of financial modeling and analysis and act as a thought partner to various business development team leads globally', 'interface with external executives alongside seasoned business development professionals to forge complex deals and relationships']["what we're looking for"]['3 - 6 years as an analyst at a leading investment bank, private equity, consulting firm, or tech company in an analytical role', 'highly analytical with strong financial modeling and complex problem solving skills', 'effective oral and written communication skills', 'familiarity collaborating with and presenting to senior executives', 'ability to work in cross functional teams (business development, legal, finance, accounting, etc.)', 'ability to multi-task and deal with time pressure in an unstructured environment; ability to work through uncertainty', 'undergraduate degree from a top school, with demonstrated strong academic performance', 'sql capability or willingness to learn is a plus']

job_description_all_future: ['strategy and industry engagement lead, technology-enabled national healthy population (tenhp)', 'the project is an endorsed smart nation initiative (first in a citizen-fronting deployable application space) and will involve the creation of a nation-wide platform to collect, through smart devices such as wearables, real-time and personalized biometric and wellness data.\xa0 such data, matched to clinical records, can create personalized applications, delivered through smart devices, that will help nudge our citizens to healthier behaviours; predict or even pre-empt medical situations like stroke, falls and heart attacks; and\xa0improve chronic disease management and coordination of care across health,\xa0social and\xa0consumer entities. the platform is an open public-private one with government playing the role of a neutral and trusted data-broker to\xa0multilateralise\xa0data-sharing for health innovation and service delivery.', "this project has the ambition to create a step-improvement in health promotion and chronic disease management, pioneering capabilities with tech giants to front global-first co-innovation. it will also allow for the real time tracking of the singapore population's health behaviours, and potentially give government a much more accurate read of how the population responds to policy changes and allow for personalised services delivered at national scale.\xa0 by providing a research platform for new medical interventions, it has the potential to accelerate the adoption of a whole range of clinical interventions.\xa0 the project will involve a range private sector players coming in to use singapore as a test bed to trial new products and services in precision health and medicine.\xa0 key technologies that are likely to be trialled in this project are health related wearable and sensor technology, big data analytics, machine learning, behavioural science, genomics and precision medicine.", '\xa0', 'the strategy and industry lead will assist the coordinating director to:']['strategise, plan and formulate the vision, implementation strategy and roadmap (including workstreams, team structures, timelines and budgets) for tenhp;', 'reach out, assess, prioritise and implement key partnerships with private sector leaders in technology and healthcare sector to participate on our platform. this includes rallying and coordinating action from moh and wog implementation agencies and stakeholders (hpb, ihis, regional hospital systems, govtech, snpo, a*star, edb, universities and research institutes), cutting through red tape to move quickly on joint industry\xa0engagement\xa0on all health technology matters;', 'manage, assess and report on overall project progress (business, technology, industry, policy, comms/marketing etc.), manage inter-dependencies and key project risks, and suggest adjustments to strategy and implementation plan to maximise value optimisation. this involves using new tools and coordinating beyond public sector to private sector partners as well in a cross-functional team.'][][]
